value:
I've traveled across many lands in my
time, but this one seems...peculiar.

Wherever there are people, there will
be conflict. And wherever there is
conflict, I can find work.

Rest when you can. Our line of work
will wear you down if you let it.

Bored? You can stay here and waste
time, or you can hone your blade.
The choice is yours.

I'm seeking bug-repelling herbs. The
greenery here is nice, but it attracts a
lot of bugs. Little monsters...

I'm here on a mission. I was directed
to deliver greetings
from $Nf.

I will train to hone my skills as best
I can.

An efficient weapon is everything to
a mercenary.
Ugh... No good.
Good. A new weapon in my arsenal.

My name is Shamir. I work with the
Knights of Seiros. I'm here if you
need anyone taken care of.

I'm not eager to bend the knee to
anyone, but mercenaries
need employers.$k$pA good employer is the kind that
pays. Or, at the very least, doesn't
treat mercs like expendable pawns.$k$pThat's to say, I haven't had any of
those concerns working for you. It's
been mostly pleasant...$k$p*ahem* My apologies. I didn't intend
to get so emotional. There's no room
for that on the battlefield.$k$pRemember that a good leader knows
how to lead from behind. Keep that in
mind, and don't get in my way.
(exertion)
Got you now!
Damn.
Die!
Nothing personal.
Hate me all you want.
End of the line!
Going for the kill!
Just when I'd found purpose...
Hmph.
I'm not amused.
It would be in your best interest to stop.
I was an outsider in FÃ³dlan as well, but I devoted myself all the same. Nothing has changed.
I have trained to overcome all fear. Including bugs. Creepy little monsters...
Swords, lances, bows... Whatever the weapon, I'm ready.
A good mercenary stays focused. Nothing can be allowed to get in the way of the assignment.
I'll join you if you're heading out. Can't risk losing an employer.
To work.
What is it?
Fine.
